intro: Zexmenia squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrosa zexmenia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to Australia, characterized by its glandular hairs and woolly leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Zexmenia squarrosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils.
